refnamediv.refpurpose: Generates a stiffness (connection) matrix for use in scanu/scanu2.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Generates a stiffness matrix from a text file of triples numbers.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: The file named in version 1 or the file stiff.num in the second case is read to create the matrix.

refsect1.title: Matrix Format
refsect1.para:
The first line of the file should be
<MATRIX size=integer>
and it creates a square matrix of the indicated size. This is followed by lines of two or three numbers, the first two denoting a connection from the first to the second. The third number is a weight; a weight of 2 is like having two links so more information gets distributed, while a zero weight means no link. If this third number is omitted it is taken as value 1. The list is terminated by a
</MATRIX>
line or end of file.

Example of this matrix format:
<MATRIX size=16> 1 2 2 2 3 1 3 4 3 4 5 1 5 6 4 6 7 1 7 8 5 8 9 6 9 10 7 10 11 6 11 12 5 12 13 4 13 14 3 14 15 2 15 16 1 16 1 9 14 13 2 10 3 6 6 4 2 2 14 7 </MATRIX>
can be given as zero in which case a size*size table is created. If the size in the gen statememt is too small for the matrix then space is re-allocated to the required size.
Note: to avoid confusion with other matrix formats, it is best to save this matrix format file using the extension file.matrxT.
